required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Visceral Osteopathic Manipulations on Low Back Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Visceral Osteopathic Manipulations on Low Back Pain Caused by Visceral Dysfunctions

brief_summary.textblock: Forty female patients with age ranging from 30-40 years old were suffering from low back pain due to visceral dysfunctions participated in this study. They were recruited from a private clinic. They were assigned into two groups equal in number; Group (A): included twenty patients who received osteopathic manipulative techniques, 1 session per week for 3 weeks, and Group (B): included twenty patients who received only analgesic drugs.

detailed_description.textblock:
Twenty patients received osteopathic manipulative techniques including Suboccipital release technique, diaphragmatic release.,mesentery release and Colonic manipulation were applied to the study group according to the patients' needs.
The treatment program comprised a total of 3 sessions for 3 weeks at one session per week for an average of 50 minutes per session. Twenty patients in the second group (control ) took only analgesics during the three weeks.

primary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to after 3 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The patient determined the pain intensity on a 10 cm scale marked with points ranging from predetermined no pain and excruciating pain

primary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to after 3 weeks
primary_outcome.description: (ODI) consists of 10 items on the degree of severity to which back (or leg) trouble has affected the ability to manage in everyday life.

primary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to after 3 weeks
primary_outcome.description: the participant stood erect while the lumbosacral junction was marked as indicated by the dimples of Venus. For measuring the MST, we put a mark 5 cm below and 10 cm above the junction. The participant was asked to bend forward as far as possible and the stretched distance of these two points was measured as the MST value.

arm_group.description: Group (A): included Twenty patients who received osteopathic manipulative techniques, 1 session per week for 3 weeks.
Group (B): included twenty patients who received analgesic drugs only.

intervention.description: Osteopathic manipulative techniques including; suboccipital release technique,sacral release technique, diaphragmatic release, mesentery release, and Colonic manipulation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Non-specific low back pain for more than 12 weeks
Exclusion Criteria:
- Malignant tumor
- Pregnancy
- Acute ischemic bowel disease,
- Intestinal obstruction,
- surgery in the last six months
